title: 2024 Controllers Intern
jobDescription:
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!

What You Can Expect At BBH:

If you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.

Controllers Intern

Brown Brothers Harriman (BBH) is a privately-held financial institution that has been a thought leader and solutions provider for 200 years.  At BBH, we value passionate, committed people who enjoy collaborating with others to find new solutions to complex business challenges. We are looking for a motivated problem solvers with a desire to learn and work as part of a team!

About the Team:

Currently looking for highly motivated and determined individuals to join us as our Financial Analyst Interns. The Financial Analyst will work on Project Teams within the Investor Services Global Finance Division. This project team performs some core financial reporting work and will also focus on specialized accounting and financial planning and analysis projects.

This team is responsible for the following:

  • Management reporting
  • Financial forecasting & the annual budget
  • Multi-year financial planning
  • Investment program reporting and ROI analysis
  • Financial Benchmarking
  • Client and product profitability
  • New Business pricing
  • Ad hoc financial analysis in support of Line of Business strategy

 
Your Intern responsibilities include:

  • Assist team to produce standard financial reporting and benchmarking
  • Create data views to support ad-hoc requests using Excel and Data Visualization tools (Qlik)
  • Assist in creating formal presentations using PowerPoint and Excel graphs and charts with analysis of the result.


What you will learn:

  • Develop technical knowledge and skillsets
  • Build professional relationships for information, support, references, learning, coaching and feedback
  • Exposure to BBH business and culture


Qualifications:

  • Currently a junior in college, entering senior year in fall of 2024
  • Strong academic achievement as evidenced through a GPA of 3.3 or higher
  • Tracking towards an Accounting, Finance, or Economics degree
  • Knowledge of accounting principles and financial analysis
  • Proven ability to work in Excel and PowerPoint
  • Prior coding experience (RStudio) preferred
  • Interest in the Financial Services Industry and curiosity about financial markets

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.
